nodes.name: Correlation
nodes.description: calculates the correlation between two series of data.
nodes.details:
This node calculates the correlation between two series of data in a common operation in Statistics.

More at Spark MLlib/ML docs page : spark.apache.org/docs/latest/mllib-statistics.html#correlations

nodes.name: SummaryStatistics
nodes.description: Summary statistics provide useful information about sample data. eg: measures of spread.
nodes.details:
Summary statistics provides useful information about sample data. eg: measures of spread.

More at Spark MLlib/ML docs page : spark.apache.org/docs/latest/mllib-statistics.html#summary-statistics

Summary Node provides a table consist of informations such as number of non-null entries (count), mean, standard deviation, and minimum and maximum value for each numerical column.

fields.name: comment
fields.value:
Data Exploration:


Data Exploration is about describing the data by means of statistical and visualization techniques. We explore data in order to understand the features and bring important features to our models.


Summary:

Univariate analysis takes data, summarizes that variables (attributes) one by one and finds patterns in the data.

There are many ways that can describe patterns found in univariate data include central tendency (mean, mode and median) and dispersion: range, variance, maximum, minimum, quartiles (including the interquartile range), coefficient of variation and standard deviation.


Correlation is a statistical technique(Multivariate analysis) that can show whether and how strongly pairs of variables are related. For example, price and lotsize are related; large lotsize houses tend to be costlier than small lotsize houses.
fields.title: Comment
